1 Cut the sausage links and place the sausages over the baking paper, use a large enough oven tray so that it allows some room around each of the sausages. 2  Place sausages in oven and roast for 15 minutes or until cooked. 3  Shake the oven tray from time to time to turn the sausages so they brown evenly.

1 Place them back in the oven for another 10 minutes or until sausage is thoroughly cooked through. 2  Remove finished sausage to paper towels or brown paper and blot excess grease off of the links with paper towels. 3  Repeat process until entire 3-pounds of sausage is cooked.

Place the baking sheet on the middle rack of the oven to ensure even cooking. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. 1  Note that thicker sausages may need to bake longer. 2  Extremely large or thick links may need to be baked anywhere from 40 to 60 minutes. 3  If cooking them this long, however, you should turn the sausages at least once.

Baking. 20% of sausages are baked. To bake, put the sausages in a roasting tin and place them in a medium oven (gas mark 4 or 180 degrees) for 35 to 45 minutes. Baking can dry the sausages so baste them in the juices 2 or 3 times during cooking.
